title: Gordon Ramsay 'gets green light to build igloo cabin in garden'
text:
Gordon Ramsay, wife Tana and some pics of what his new igloo might look like (Pictures: Getty; Iglucraft)

Gordon Ramsay is probably feeling pretty chill after reportedly receiving planning permission to build a £30,000 ‘igloo’ cabin within the grounds of his £4 million Cornwall property.

According to MailOnline, the celebrity chef’s new project will take pride of place in his back garden in Trebetherick.

Confusingly, however, the structures by Estonian company Iglucraft are actually made of wood.

The stylish cabin will boast central heating, a kitchen and a toilet, the report states.

As reported in August, documents supposedly obtained by Cornwall Live showed Gordon had submitted the planning application to Cornwall Council.

A look inside one of the cabins on offer by Iglucraft (Picture: Iglucraft)

They allegedly stated the cabin would ‘provide semi-independent self-contained accommodation for the applicant’s family and visiting friends but used as accommodation incidental to the enjoyment of the main property, Daymer Bay House.’

The documents also stated that the project would provide ‘space for a bed, kitchen/living room area and toilet, the outbuilding would have a insulated wooden frame faced externally with spruce shingles and finished internally with aspen wall panelling and an insulated floor.’

Gordon had a similar plan for an igloo within the grounds of his London home approved earlier this year.

Gordon has been a familiar face on TV since the 90s (Picture: Rex Features)

A rep for Gordon declined to comment when contacted by Metro.co.uk.

The news follows Gordon’s recent comments that he reached out to fellow famous chef Jamie Oliver after the collapse of his restaurant chain.

He said on The Jonathan Ross show: ‘That was devastating, I don’t think anyone likes to revel in that kind of failure.

‘Bottom line is, he’s a great guy and a great chef and it was sad to see him disappear overnight but we had a drink and it was a tough time, like it is for all of us out there… Yeah [I called] straight away.’

Gordon and wife Tana, who tied the knot in 1996, are parents to five children: 21-year-old daughter Megan, Matilda, 17, 19-year-old twins Jack and Holly and the newest addition to family, 6-month-old Oscar.
